translation.translation[0].definitions[0: when you translate something, or something that has been translated
She read the letter and gave us a rough translation (=she did not translate everything exactly).
I’ve only read ‘Madame Bovary’ in translation (=not in its original language).
Much of the book’s humour has been lost in translation  (=is no longer effective when translated).
a new translation of the Bible
translation.translation[0].definitions[1: the process of changing something into a different form
translation.translation[0].note_box[0].s: She had done a translation of the poem.
It’s a rough translation but I think the meaning is clear.
The most accurate translation of the word would be ‘master’.
First make a literal translation and then try and put it into idiomatic English.
He wrote the first English translation of Homer’s 'Iliad'.
translation.translation[1].definitions[0: the process of changing one currency into another
After translation into Swiss francs, the only division showing a decline in sales was agriculture.
translation.translation[1].definitions[1: the process of changing something into a different form, usually to produce a final result
The rapid translation from prototype to new product gives companies little time to rest between projects.
